_comment: Add a _ before an option name to comment it out and it wont be added to the apworld
Using 'goal' as the name of an option let you override some of the generated goal parameters
description: How to end your randomized playthrough.
Out With A Bang (Elite Race Qualified): Complete the 12 Episodes and end in 3rd or higher in the final Elite Race.
Perfection: Complete the Perfection achievement, coming in 1st in all Events.

filler_traps._comment: Using values here let you set a 'recommended' filler_trap percentage or even a default percentage

description: This is a Toggle
A simple boolean, aka True or False set the initial value with "default"
This is a Choice
Let the user pick from a list of values
allow_custom_value let a player define their own text value
Currently the only use for Choice in Manual outside of hooks is the goal
This is a Range
Allow the player to specify a value between 'start' and 'end'
if you include a "values" you can define the label for certain values
Currently the only use for Range in Manual outside of hooks is 'filler_trap'
Enable the non-grindy achievement decals as Locations. Does not include online achievments or the achievement for owning Pure.
Enable the grindy achievement decals as Locations. Does not include online achievments or the achievement for owning Pure.
Enable a progressive unlock method for Episodes, to reduce chances of getting stuck for long periods of time.
When completing an Elite Race, always choose the leftmost Episode.
Enable a progressive unlock method for cars, to be similar to the vanilla game.
If you enable this option, you can view the car order on the wiki, starting from the Ryback Brawler: https://splitsecond-velocity.fandom.com/wiki/Brawler
Select whether to begin with only 1 of the 3 starter cars. The others become Items.
Select whether to begin with a random additional car, selected from all cars.
Select whether to allow variants of cars as filler items.
Select what event position counts as a Win, for Win checks.
Purely informational.
Select whether Power Plays are locked as Items. You cannot use Power Plays until they have been obtained.
Select whether Power Plays are progressive.
If enabled, Level 1 Power Plays will be unlocked before Level 2 Power Plays.
Select whether to enable Random Car Traps, which force you to choose a random unlocked car for the next Event when triggered.
Use a randomization method of your choice when triggered.
Use the filler_traps option above to change the amount of traps.
Select whether to enable Forced Power Play Traps, which force you to trigger a Power Play when triggered (regardless of unlock).
Use a method of your choice, such as tapping the Power Play keys or turning on an autoclicker when triggered, until the next activation.
Use the filler_traps option above to change the amount of traps.
